page.title: 16HUNTCLIFFE SCHOOL, SALTBURN
page.content: Just 18 months after winning a battle to keep it open, Huntcliff, Saltburn's only Comprehensive School is again under threat of closure. This is one of four options being considered by Cleveland County Council which could affect the future of the school. The Authority is concerned about the fall in roll which could damage the curriculum and the money it could save by closing the school. The people of Saltburn have formed an Action Group to fight these proposals as they firmly believe the community should have its own school. The loss of Huntcliff they believe would adversly affect the future of the community. They are also worried about how the children would get to the school in Marske and the dangers involved in walking along the main road. A decision will be made in July 1985.
